having seen a customer success story let us now look at Ott in general and how the traditional
media supply chain was so Ott basically stands for over the top video which
means internet which means the video streams are made available to the end users over the Internet traditionally
the media supply chain was fragile and rigid the content was produced in one
place and then transported to another for further processing and finally delivered to the end users this meant
that there was very little room for flexibility and personalization this also meant that the delivery was low and
it required a lot of planning well ahead of time as a result some Innovation had
to happen and The Innovation happened in the form of cloud so with migration to the cloud the
entire control came in a single place AWS offers a lot of managed Services
which enables you to maintain the same video quality along with increased
scalability flexibility and reliability you can now make your content available
to end users on various Platforms in minutes rather than days AWS offers
plenty of managed services to make sure that the video streams are made available to the end users seamlessly we
did see a customer success story on how they Leverage The managed services to create the route 80 infrastructure so
AWS offers plenty of managed Services which can help you in your journey towards migrating your Ott
infrastructure to the cloud so having seen the basics of Ott we
would now see simple Ott workflow a simple Ott workflow can be divided into five steps
before it reaches the end user uh to stream on various players it always
begins with contribution so contribution is a step where the content is transported or acquired in the cloud the
second step is transcoding so transcoding is a process wherein or where a content is processed to reduce
the size to stream it easily over the Internet this step is very important in
Ott because no matter how fast the internet speeds have become now they're still not enough to transport raw
uncompressed video to All the end user devices also not all end user devices can support high quality video content
so you can think of transcoding as an intelligent step where a raw video is
taken and compressed in such a way that the important bits still remain to be
played on the end user devices but the size actually goes down and the size goes down tremendously people will see
you know a file based transcoder in the upcoming slides to understand the magnitude of how the size is reduced
when the transcoding happens after the transcoding step is done the stream is further processed By An Origin or stored
on a distributed storage like S3 before getting delivered to the end users from the CDN the further processing on Origin
can involve things like just-in-time packaging to convert streams to formats
like hls Dash smooth or cmaf depending upon the user that plays the device and
it also can add encryption layer or DRM protection layer on your streams to pre
to ensure that your streams are only accessed by users who are authorized to access it and once the uh once the
origination happens it undergoes further processing in the form of personalization this is an optional step
but this is an important feature as it includes user element advertisements to
make your content uh relevant for the end users thereby increasing viewership as well as using this opportunity to
monetize your streams using Impressions with the help of monetization and personalization the uh tuning of users
into the stream is maintained because users are presented with the advertisements which are relevant for
them for example if a person is into sports using the monetization part of your Ott workflow you can show them uh
Sports relevant advertisement thereby the relevancy increases and also the continuity of people into the
advertisement also increases and by using these advertisements the content providers are able to make money out of
it by uh using the Impressions which are in which increase as and when advertisements are played back and
finally distribution is a process where the streams are delivered to the end users using local caching servers
thereby improving quality and efficiency so having seen the uh Ott workflow
blocks I would like to say that AWS offers managed services in all of these

is then stored on a distributed storage system like S3 which acts as An Origin
on your uh for your Cloud Print CDN the cloud print CDN delivers the content to

for live AWS provide the contribution encoder called AWS Elemental live this
